clfLdaTrain

PURPOSE

Train a Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) classifier.

SYNOPSIS

function clf = clfLdaTrain( clf, X, Y )

DESCRIPTION 

 Train a Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) classifier.

 USAGE
  clf = clfLdaTrain( clf, X, Y )

 INPUTS
  clf     - model to be trained
  X       - nxp data  array
  Y       - nx1 array of labels (or cell array, see classify.m)

 OUTPUTS
  clf     - a trained LDA model

 EXAMPLE

 See also CLFLDA, CLFLDAFWD

0024 if( ~strcmp(clf.type,'lda')); error( ['incorrect type: ' clf.type] ); end
0025 if( size(X,2)~= clf.p ); error( 'Incorrect data dimension' ); end

0027 %er = consist( clf, , X );  error(er);
0028 prior = clf.prior;  type = clf.clfLdaType;
0029 
0030 % grp2idx sorts a numeric grouping var ascending, and a string grouping
0031 % var by order of first occurrence
0032 [gindex,groups] = grp2idx(Y);  gtype = Y(1);
0033 ngroups = length(groups);
0034 gsize = hist(gindex,1:ngroups);
0035 [n,d] = size(X);
0036 
0037 %%% GET PRIOR ACCORDINGLY
0038 if isempty(prior)
0039   % Default to a uniform prior
0040   prior = ones(1, ngroups) / ngroups;
0041 elseif( ischar(prior) && ~isempty(strmatch(lower(prior), 'empirical')))
0042   % Estimate prior from relative Y sizes
0043   prior = gsize(:)' / sum(gsize);
0044 elseif( isnumeric(prior))
0045   % Explicit prior
0046   if( min(size(prior)) ~= 1 || max(size(prior)) ~= ngroups )
0047     error('PRIOR must be a vector one element for each Y.');
0048   elseif any(prior < 0)
0049     error('PRIOR cannot contain negative values.');
0050   end;
0051   prior = prior(:)' / sum(prior); % force a normalized row vector
0052 elseif isstruct(prior)
0053   [pgindex,pgroups] = grp2idx(prior.Y);
0054   ord = repmat(NaN,1,ngroups);
0055   for i = 1:ngroups
0056     j = strmatch(groups(i), pgroups(pgindex), 'exact');
0057     if ~isempty(j); ord(i) = j; end
0058   end
0059   if any(isnan(ord))
0060     error('PRIOR.Y must contain all of the unique values in GROUP.'); end
0061   prior = prior.prob(ord);
0062   if any(prior < 0)
0063     error('PRIOR.prob cannot contain negative values.'); end;
0064   prior = prior(:)' / sum(prior); % force a normalized row vector
0065 else
0066   error('PRIOR must be a vector, structure, or the string ''empirical''.');
0067 end
0068 
0069 
0070 %%% get means for each group
0071 gmeans = repmat(NaN, ngroups, d);
0072 for k = 1:ngroups
0073   gmeans(k,:) = mean(X(gindex==k,:),1);  end;
0074 
0075 
0076 %%% get R (or RS)
0077 switch type
0078   case 1 % 'linear'
0079     if n <= ngroups
0080       error('TRAINING must have more observs than number of groups.'); end
0081 
0082     % Pooled estimate of covariance
0083     [Q,R] = qr(X - gmeans(gindex,:), 0);
0084     R = R / sqrt(n - ngroups); % SigmaHat = R'*R
0085     s = svd(R);
0086     if any(s <= max(s) * eps(class(s))^(3/4))
0087       warning('cov matrix of TRAIN must be pos definite.'); end %#ok<WNTAG>
0088     clf.R = R;
0089 
0090   case {2,3} % 'quadratic' or 'mahalanobis'
0091     if any(gsize <= 1)
0092       error('Each Y in TRAINING must have at least two observations.'); end
0093 
0094     for k = 1:ngroups
0095       % Stratified estimate of covariance
0096       [Q,R] = qr(X(gindex==k,:) - repmat(gmeans(k,:), gsize(k), 1), 0);
0097       R = R / sqrt(gsize(k) - 1); % SigmaHat = R'*R
0098       s = svd(R);
0099       if any(s <= max(s) * eps(class(s))^(3/4))
0100         error('cov matrix of each Y in TRAINING must be pos definite.');end
0101       clf.RS{k}=R;
0102     end
0103 end
